response.original_title: Arqueologia no DOI-Codi: Rompendo o Silêncio
response.overview: The film portrays the archaeological excavations carried out at the headquarters of the now-defunct DOI-Codi (Information Operations Detachment – ​​Internal Defense Operations Center), a place where, it is estimated, more than 7,000 political kidnappers experienced torture and horror. The complex of five buildings, listed in 2014, operated from 1969 to 1983 as a repressive agency of the brazilian military dictatorship. The researchers' search for material remains and evidence of the passage of victims of repression through the site, such as inscriptions on the walls, personal objects and paper records, is essential to keeping alive the memory of the atrocities of the military dictatorship in Brazil.
